body_html:
@girving , tf.image.random_crop has changed to tf.random_crop.
And now this bug seems to be solved naturally.
I can use resize_images to correctly resize images using the following codes.

from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data 
mnist = input_data.read_data_sets('MNIST_data', one_hot=True)
import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.InteractiveSession()
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
arr = mnist.train.images[:10].reshape([10,28,28,1])
plt.imshow(arr[5,:,:,0])
images = tf.convert_to_tensor(arr, name='images')

def _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge):
    return tf.cast(width*new_shorter_edge/height, tf.int32)

shape = tf.shape(images)
height = shape[1]
width = shape[2]
new_shorter_edge = tf.constant(400, dtype=tf.int32)

height_smaller_than_width = tf.less_equal(height, width)
new_height_and_width = tf.cond(
    height_smaller_than_width,
    lambda: (new_shorter_edge, _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge)),
    lambda: (_compute_longer_edge(width, height, new_shorter_edge), new_shorter_edge)
)

images_ = tf.image.resize_images(images, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1])
#image = tf.image.resize_bilinear(images, tf.pack(new_height_and_width))
images_ = tf.Print(images_, [tf.shape(images_), height, width, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1]])

res = sess.run(tf.random_crop(images_, [10,224, 224,1]))
plt.imshow(res[5,:,:,0])

@girving , tf.image.random_crop has changed to tf.random_crop.
And now this bug seems to be solved naturally.
I can use resize_images to correctly resize images using the following codes.
from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data 
mnist = input_data.read_data_sets('MNIST_data', one_hot=True)
import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.InteractiveSession()
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
arr = mnist.train.images[:10].reshape([10,28,28,1])
plt.imshow(arr[5,:,:,0])
images = tf.convert_to_tensor(arr, name='images')

def _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge):
    return tf.cast(width*new_shorter_edge/height, tf.int32)

shape = tf.shape(images)
height = shape[1]
width = shape[2]
new_shorter_edge = tf.constant(400, dtype=tf.int32)

height_smaller_than_width = tf.less_equal(height, width)
new_height_and_width = tf.cond(
    height_smaller_than_width,
    lambda: (new_shorter_edge, _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge)),
    lambda: (_compute_longer_edge(width, height, new_shorter_edge), new_shorter_edge)
)

images_ = tf.image.resize_images(images, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1])
#image = tf.image.resize_bilinear(images, tf.pack(new_height_and_width))
images_ = tf.Print(images_, [tf.shape(images_), height, width, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1]])

res = sess.run(tf.random_crop(images_, [10,224, 224,1]))
plt.imshow(res[5,:,:,0])
body:
@girving , tf.image.random_crop has changed to tf.random_crop.
And now this bug seems to be solved naturally.
I can use resize_images to correctly resize images using the following codes.

```
from tensorflow.examples.tutorials.mnist import input_data 
mnist = input_data.read_data_sets('MNIST_data', one_hot=True)
import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.InteractiveSession()
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
arr = mnist.train.images[:10].reshape([10,28,28,1])
plt.imshow(arr[5,:,:,0])
images = tf.convert_to_tensor(arr, name='images')

def _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge):
    return tf.cast(width*new_shorter_edge/height, tf.int32)

shape = tf.shape(images)
height = shape[1]
width = shape[2]
new_shorter_edge = tf.constant(400, dtype=tf.int32)

height_smaller_than_width = tf.less_equal(height, width)
new_height_and_width = tf.cond(
    height_smaller_than_width,
    lambda: (new_shorter_edge, _compute_longer_edge(height, width, new_shorter_edge)),
    lambda: (_compute_longer_edge(width, height, new_shorter_edge), new_shorter_edge)
)

images_ = tf.image.resize_images(images, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1])
#image = tf.image.resize_bilinear(images, tf.pack(new_height_and_width))
images_ = tf.Print(images_, [tf.shape(images_), height, width, new_height_and_width[0], new_height_and_width[1]])

res = sess.run(tf.random_crop(images_, [10,224, 224,1]))
plt.imshow(res[5,:,:,0])
```
